issue.title: HTTP2: Remove outdated docs

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

The notes about the stability of the codec is outdated. Let's remove it so people are not confused.

Modifications:

Remove outdated doc

Result:

Fixes https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/15717

body: @ihrasko its outdated... Thanks for bringing this to my attention. Fixed https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/15720

body:
Thanks a lot.

IMO there are some remaining parts, for example here: https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/15724.

issue.title: HTTP2 duplex examples: update docs

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

The notes about the stability of the "multiplexing" http2 API are outdated. Let's update them so people are not confused.

Modifications:

Update outdated doc.

Result:

Fixes #15717

body:
And IMO this is also related: https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/15725.

Thus I assume multiplexing API was experimental just because of frame codec usage and now it is ready to use, too
